name: Bladder Cancer
description: Cancer that forms in the bladder, the organ that stores urine.

name: Breast Cancer
description: Cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts, most common in women.

name: Colon and Rectal Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the colon or rectum, often referred to as colorectal cancer.

name: Endometrial Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the lining of the uterus.

name: Kidney Cancer
description: Cancer that starts in the kidneys, often referred to as renal cell carcinoma.

name: Leukemia
description: A type of cancer that affects blood and bone marrow, characterized by the overproduction of abnormal white blood cells.

name: Liver Cancer
description: Cancer that originates in the liver, often associated with chronic liver disease.

name: Lung Cancer
description: Cancer that begins in the lungs, often linked to smoking and air pollution.

name: Melanoma
description: A serious form of skin cancer that begins in the melanocytes, the cells that produce pigment.

name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
description: A group of blood cancers that includes all types of lymphoma except Hodgkin's lymphoma.

name: Pancreatic Cancer
description: Cancer that starts in the pancreas, often diagnosed at an advanced stage.

name: Prostate Cancer
description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate, a small walnut-shaped gland that produces seminal fluid.

name: Thyroid Cancer
description: Cancer that forms in the thyroid gland, which is located in the neck.

name: Atrial fibrillation
description: A heart condition that causes an irregular and often rapid heartbeat.

name: Coronary artery disease
description: A disease caused by the buildup of plaque in the coronary arteries, leading to reduced blood flow to the heart.

name: Heart failure
description: A condition in which the heart is unable to pump sufficiently to maintain blood flow to meet the body's needs.

name: Heart valve disease
description: A condition affecting one or more of the heart's valves, which can disrupt blood flow.

name: Hypertensive heart disease
description: Heart problems that occur because of high blood pressure.

name: Myocardial infarction
description: Commonly known as a heart attack, it occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked.

name: Pericarditis
description: An inflammation of the pericardium, the fibrous sac surrounding the heart.

name: Cardiomyopathy
description: A disease of the heart muscle that affects its size, shape, and ability to pump blood.

name: Congenital heart defects
description: Heart problems that are present at birth, affecting the structure of the heart.

name: Arrhythmia
description: An irregular heartbeat that can occur in various forms, affecting how the heart beats.

name: Asthma
description: A chronic condition that inflames and narrows the airways, causing difficulty in breathing.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make it difficult to breathe.

name: Acute Bronchitis
description: An inflammation of the bronchial tubes, usually caused by a viral infection.

name: Pulmonary Fibrosis
description: A lung disease that occurs when lung tissue becomes damaged and scarred.

name: Sarcoidosis
description: An inflammatory disease that affects multiple organs, primarily the lungs.

name: Pneumonia
description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.

name: Influenza
description: A viral respiratory infection that can cause mild to severe illness.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: A gradual loss of kidney function over time.

name: Acute Kidney Injury
description: A sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that happens within a few hours or a few days.

name: Diabetic Kidney Disease
description: Kidney damage that occurs as a result of diabetes.

name: Hypertensive Kidney Disease
description: Kidney damage caused by high blood pressure.

name: Polycystic Kidney Disease
description: A genetic disorder characterized by the growth of numerous cysts in the kidneys.

name: Glomerulonephritis
description: An inflammation of the kidney's filtering units (glomeruli).

name: Kidney Stones
description: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.

name: Nephrotic Syndrome
description: A kidney disorder that causes the body to excrete too much protein in the urine.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
description: An infection in any part of the urinary system, including the kidneys.

name: Crohn's Disease
description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation of the digestive tract.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation.

name: Celiac Disease
description: An autoimmune disorder where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine.

name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
description: A digestive disorder that affects the lower esophageal sphincter, causing acid reflux.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
description: A condition where open sores develop on the lining of the stomach or the upper part of the small intestine.

name: Diverticulitis
description: An inflammation or infection of small pouches that can form in the intestines.

name: Gallstones
description: Solid particles that form from bile cholesterol and bilirubin in the gallbladder.

name: Constipation
description: A common digestive issue characterized by infrequent bowel movements or difficulty passing stools.

name: Diarrhea
description: A condition characterized by frequent, loose, or watery bowel movements.

name: Anemia
description: A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues.

name: Hemophilia
description: A rare disorder in which your blood doesn't clot normally because it lacks sufficient blood-clotting proteins (clotting factors).

name: Sickle Cell Disease
description: A group of inherited red blood cell disorders characterized by the presence of sickle-shaped red blood cells.

name: Thalassemia
description: An inherited blood disorder in which the body makes an abnormal form or inadequate amount of hemoglobin.

name: Polycythemia Vera
description: A blood cancer that causes the bone marrow to make too many red blood cells.

name: Aplastic Anemia
description: A rare condition that occurs when your body stops producing enough new blood cells.

name: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP)
description: An autoimmune disorder that leads to a decrease in the number of platelets in the blood.

name: Hemolytic Anemia
description: A condition in which red blood cells are destroyed faster than they can be made.

name: Von Willebrand Disease
description: A bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency of von Willebrand factor, a protein that helps blood clot.

name: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
description: A group of disorders caused by poorly formed or dysfunctional blood cells.

name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
description: A chronic disease that affects the central nervous system, leading to a range of neurological symptoms.

name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
description: An autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organs and systems in the body, causing inflammation and damage.

name: Psoriasis
description: A chronic autoimmune condition that results in the rapid growth of skin cells, leading to scaling and inflammation.

name: Ulcerative Colitis
description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.

name: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
description: An autoimmune disorder that affects the thyroid gland, leading to hypothyroidism.

name: Graves' Disease
description: An autoimmune disorder that leads to overactivity of the thyroid gland (hyperthyroidism).

name: Type 1 Diabetes
description: An autoimmune condition where the immune system attacks insulin-producing cells in the pancreas.

name: Sj√∂gren's Syndrome
description: An autoimmune disorder characterized by dry eyes and dry mouth due to the immune system attacking glands.

name: Type 2 Diabetes
description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose).

name: Obesity
description: A complex disease involving an excessive amount of body fat.

name: Metabolic Syndrome
description: A cluster of conditions that increase the risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes.

name: Hypothyroidism
description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones.

name: Cushing's Syndrome
description: A hormonal disorder caused by prolonged exposure of the body's tissues to high levels of cortisol.

name: Gout
description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

name: Phenylketonuria (PKU)
description: A rare inherited disorder that causes an amino acid called phenylalanine to build up in the body.

name: Galactosemia
description: A genetic disorder that affects how the body processes a simple sugar called galactose.

name: Cystic Fibrosis
description: A genetic disorder that affects the lungs and digestive system, characterized by thick mucus production.

name: Huntington's Disease
description: A progressive brain disorder caused by a single defective gene on chromosome 4, leading to movement, cognitive, and psychiatric symptoms.

name: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
description: A severe type of muscular dystrophy caused by a mutation in the dystrophin gene, leading to muscle degeneration.

name: Tay-Sachs Disease
description: A genetic disorder that results in the destruction of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, caused by a deficiency of the enzyme Hex-A.

name: Marfan Syndrome
description: A genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue, leading to features such as tall stature and heart problems.

name: Neurofibromatosis
description: A genetic disorder that causes tumors to grow on nerves, leading to skin changes and bone deformities.

name: Albinism
description: A genetic condition characterized by the absence of melanin pigment in the skin, hair, and eyes.

name: Down Syndrome
description: A genetic disorder caused by the presence of an extra chromosome 21, leading to developmental delays and physical features.

name: Multiple Sclerosis
description: A disease that affects the central nervous system, leading to a range of neurological symptoms.

name: Lupus
description: A systemic autoimmune disease that occurs when the body's immune system attacks its own tissues and organs.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive neurological disorder that causes brain cells to degenerate and die, leading to memory loss and cognitive decline.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: A progressive neurological disorder that affects movement, causing tremors, stiffness, and difficulty with balance and coordination.

name: Dystonia
description: A movement disorder characterized by involuntary muscle contractions that cause repetitive or twisting movements.

name: Essential Tremor
description: A nervous system disorder that causes rhythmic shaking, often affecting the hands, head, and voice.

name: Hydrocephalus
description: A condition in which excess cerebrospinal fluid builds up in the brain's ventricles, potentially leading to increased intracranial pressure.

name: Myasthenia Gravis
description: An autoimmune disorder that leads to weakness in the skeletal muscles, which are responsible for breathing and moving parts of the body.

name: Migraine
description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light and sound.

name: Hyperthyroidism
description: A condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone, leading to an acceleration of the body's metabolism.

name: Addison's Disease
description: A disorder in which the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones, leading to symptoms like fatigue, low blood pressure, and darkening of the skin.

name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 1
description: An autoimmune condition where the pancreas produces little or no insulin, leading to high blood sugar levels.

name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose), often associated with obesity and insulin resistance.

name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
description: A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts, leading to irregular menstrual cycles and other metabolic issues.

name: Acromegaly
description: A disorder caused by excess growth hormone, leading to enlarged bones and tissues, often due to a benign tumor on the pituitary gland.
